alert.note: Alert for South Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 3:30AM PST until January 14 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM SATURDAY TO 4 AM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 1500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 to 70 mph, especially near the Columbia River Gorge. * WHERE...South Washington Cascades. * WHEN...From 4 AM Saturday to 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage and power outages. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 35 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
